actions.text: Mr. Foley asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Rules have until midnight on April 25 to file a report on H. Res. 135. Agreed to without objection.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-37, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2072 with 1 hour of general debate. Upon adoption of the rule, the Speaker may declare the House resolved into the Committee Whole and all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of the Congressional Budget Act are waived. All points of order against the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clauses 2 and 6 of rule XXI are waived, except against the provisions beginning on page 20, line 19 through page 21, line 6; beginning on page 31, lines 5-12; and beginning on page 34, lines 19-25. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. Said amendments shall be considered in the order specified in the report, considered as having been read and debatable for not to exceed o...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 198 (Roll no. 34).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2072) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations and transfers, urgent supplementals, and correcting enrollment errors for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1989, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2072 (supplemental appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2072) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations and transfers, urgent supplementals, and correcting enrollment errors for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1989, and for other purposes.
